result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:27 AM Defendant Shone M. Bagley Sr. in court.  Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Shone M. Bagley Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Nathaniel E Adamson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Special Agent Dorinda Freymiller, of the Department of Justice Division of Criminal Investigation, sworn in and testifies on direct by Prosecuting attorney Nathaniel E Adamson.
Cross examination by attorney Barnes.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

The State needs time to file an information.
The Court will adjourn the matter for an arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Arraignment on November 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

9:02 AM Defendant Shone M. Bagley Sr. in court.  Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Shone M. Bagley Sr.  Attorney Nathaniel E Adamson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests preliminary hearing date.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on October 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, filed by Jeremy Perri

9:30 AM Attorney Nathaniel E Adamson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shone M. Bagley Sr. in court.  
Attorney McMahon appeared as a Friend of the Court.
The  Public Defender's Office is still reviewing the defendant's indigent status.
Court will reschedule this matter.
State may appear by Zoom for the next hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

State's Letter Requesting Remote Request for 8/15/2022.

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on August 10, 2022 - APPROVED**
Notice of Appearance of Counsel and Substitution
Hearing on August 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:01 PM Defendant Shone M. Bagley in court.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he will be representing himself.  Atty. Liegel states he believes the defendant can have a hearing objecting to not being eligible for public defender representation.  Court orders an attorney from the public defender's office appear for the next hearing with knowledge of the defendants request.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Atty. Liegel will not be appearing on this case anymore and a new attorney will be appearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on August 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:01 PM Defendant Shone M. Bagley in court.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he applied for representation ata the public defender's office and he states they have not verified if they are going to represent him or not.    Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant given a petition for the appointment of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Hearing on July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

08:20 AM Defendant Shone M. Bagley in court.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
The Defendant presents statements that he has had four meetings with an attorney, however due to other financial obligations he would not be able to retain one, and would like to waive his right to an attorney.
The Court cautions the Defendant going forward without counsel. 
The Court will not take a waiver of right to an attorney at this time. 
The Court orders the Defendant to call the SPD to see if he qualifies for representation.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Letter from Kathleen M. Treffert with request to seal.   **Reviewed by Judge Bohren on July 5, 2022 - Request to seal is DENIED.**
Hearing on July 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:16 AM Defendant Shone M. Bagley appeared by Zoom.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared by Zoom for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  The defendant states he has retained counsel.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victims 1-9/Michael Everhart listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   The Defendant is not to act in a fiduciary compacity for any person other than himself.

08:37 AM Defendant Shone M. Bagley in court.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.    Defendant to seek counsel.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
THE COURT AUTHORIZES ZOOM FOR ALL PARTIES  Hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
